work.p: Words and imagery from this manuscript appear in the first poem in the 1855 edition of Leaves of Grass, which was later titled "Song of Myself."
The three lines on the back of the leaf bear some resemblance in theme to the fifth poem in "Chants Democratic," a cluster of poems first published in the 1860-61 edition of Leaves of Grass.

titleStmt.title: I shall venerate hours and
a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman
titleStmt.sponsor: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities, University of Nebraska-Lincoln

availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Any reuse of the material should credit the Walt Whitman Archive. Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

notesStmt.note: Whitman probably drafted this manuscript between 1850 and 1855, as he was composing the first (1855) edition of Leaves of Grass. Words and imagery from the manuscript appear in the first poem of that edition, entitled "Leaves of Grass," eventually entitled "Song of Myself."

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Why should I subscribe money, to build some hero's statue?
bibl.orgName: The Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature, New York Public Library
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

revisionDesc.change: checked and corrected file, added corresps

lg.l:
I shall venerate hours and days, and think
their immeasurable infinite stupendous hereafter;

I am finding how much I am passing can pass through
in a few minutes.—
I was a good friend to all things before,

But now what I was seems to me limpsey
and little.

Why should I subscribe money to build a some general's hero's statue ? for
the greatest
That butcher boy with is just as great a hero
He does not know what fear is
